title: Reverse Proxy
description: a reverse proxy is the application that sits in front of back-end applications and forwards client (e.g. browser) requests to those applications. Reverse proxies help increase scalability, performance, resilience and security.
key-ideas: Placed in front of the back-end services.
Connections are returned to clients as if they came from the backend servers, but the connection in both directions goes through the proxy.
Reverse Proxies with specialized hardware can increase performance by decrypting SSL connections. This also allows it to inspect otherwise encrypted traffic.
Reverse Proxies with Web Application Firewalls can inspect and filter traffic before passing it on the the servers.
Often installed with a load balancer to balance connections across a pool of back end servers.
